title: Millionaire's son who caused death of girl, 9, years after crash freed after 7 months
text:

A millionaire's reckless son who caused the death of a young girl nine years after a horror crash has been released early from prison.

Antonio Boparan, 32, was sentenced to just 18 months in jail 13 years after ploughing his Range Rover Sport into a Jeep at 70mph in a 30mph zone.

The smash left Cerys Edwards with devastating injuries when she was just one and the youngster spent the next nine years requiring round-the-clock care and permanently dependent on a ventilator.

The tot underwent dozens of major operations over the years but died at Birmingham Children's hospital on October 17, 2015 - just a month before her tenth birthday.

(Image: PA)

(Image: PA)

Boporan, who was 19 at the time of the crash, was released six months early into a 21-month sentence for dangerous driving in 2008.

Following Cery's death, police reopened the case and a post mortem revealed the youngster had died as a result of injuries sustained in the collision.

Boparan admitted causing death by dangerous driving at Birmingham Crown Court.

The heir to a £800 million chicken fortune was caged again in March .

But Boparan, of Sutton Coldfield, West Midlands, has again been released early, it emerged today. He was freed just seven months into the 18-month term.

(Image: SWNS)

Mirror Online has today approached Cerys' family for comment.

Speaking previously, Cerys' grief-stricken dad Gareth Edwards said: "Police have found his actions caused the death of my daughter so he is a child killer, simple as that.

"He killed my daughter.

"I want to see him in that dock again facing charges of manslaughter or murder. He used that motor vehicle to kill my daughter."

(Image: PA)

(Image: Birmingham Post And Mail)

The devastated builder, who since the crash has spilt with his wife and Cerys mother, added: "I cannot turn the clock back - my daughter is gone and is six feet under - all I can do is fight for justice for that little girl.

"Cerys is the victim of this. She could not talk, she could not walk, but I will stand up and fight for justice for her.

"He needs to serve a proper sentence for what he did. He is scum."

(Image: PA)

(Image: SWNS)

Cerys was awarded £5million compensation in 2012, along with a guaranteed annual payout of £450,000 to help pay for her annual care bill.

At the time Judge Martin McKenna, sitting at Birmingham County Court, described it as the "saddest and most tragic case" he had ever come across.

The Range Rover Boparan was driving in November 2006 was owned by his wealthy parents, Ranjit and Baljinder Boparan, who run the 2 Sisters Food Group - the third largest food company in the UK by turnover with an annual revenue of £3.4billion.

Mr Edwards also branded the 18-month sentence handed down to Boparan as an insult.

He said: "Boparan will only serve around 15 months behind bars in total for killing a child and destroying several lives, which is a complete insult.

"We have been left with a life sentence without our beautiful little girl whose precious life was stolen from us."
description: Antonio Boparan left Cerys Edwards with catastrophic injuries after ploughing his Range Rover Sport into a Jeep at 70mph in a 30mph zone in Sutton Coldfield, West Midlands
